DataElement.preferredName: Next Generation Sequencing Report Targeted Therapy Options Generation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a next generation sequencing (NGS) report contain suggested targeted therapy options.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Next Generation Sequencing Report Targeted Therapy Options Generation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the DNA sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A short textual account; having provided a short account.._A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments._Alternative choices or actions._The act of bringing into being.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Next Generation Sequencing Therapeutic Procedure Report
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the DNA sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Concepts.definition: Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the nucleotide sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA or RNA.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments.:Alternative choices or actions.:The act of bringing into being.

Concepts.definition: A type of cancer treatment that uses testing and medication to more precisely identify and treat cancer. These treatments target and disable genes or proteins necessary to the proliferation of cancer cells.
The act of bringing into being.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
